Title: I Felt I Purchased a Used Laptop!
Review: Note: I never played games on itCons:*Right out of the box, there was dusts on the laptop; a couples of tiny chipped paint; the bottom rubber legs were dusty as if the laptop had been sitting & pushed around on a desk for a while!; plastic package of the AC cable was wrung and had tears(did you really ran out of new plastics!)*The battery meter wrong readings; battery really struggled to charge over 95%*The display flickered randomly*Overheating and loud fan noise (which I guess is typical for gaming laptops), but it happened w/ basic work like checking emailsPro:Thin for a gaming laptop*I returned it and won't recommend it to anyone
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021

Title: FEATURES GALORE!
Review: Not gonna lie, super impressed with this laptop. Was considering an HP Spectre or Galaxy Book Pro, but stumbled across this on here of all places. It had everything i was looking for & more than what I even realized.Presentation in box was nice. Like how it is packaged in a dust sleeve & even has a dust sleeve in-between screen & keyboard. Major plus mark for that alone.Upon booting first time & getting initially set up, enjoyed how nice the screen is. IPS is the way to go, ngl. Keyboard light & RGB options are a major upgrade for my use. Selection of apps & programs from the get go are too numerous to mention, but is nice to have plenty of options. After removing what didn't interest me, proceeded with updates, as you should with any device.This thing seems like Sonic... GOTTA GO FAST!Dragon Center App has tons of various tweaks & options for things like Keyboard RGB light, Power/ Battery, Performance, etc. Definite plus for that alone. Some people can't stand it, so I'll leave that up to particular preference.Yes, the fans can he EXTREMELY NOISY... BUT for my particular usage & wants in a laptop, quite a fair trade off. Only way they get THAT noisy, is if you select extreme performance/ cooler boost. A good pair of headphones would drown that noise.Another surprise, is that you can run android games either through The appropriate MSI app or even Bluestacks... was not aware of when I decided to purchase, but cool nonetheless. I would say remove the MSI App Player & just use true Bluestacks, if you want to mess with Amdroid emulationWith this, I plan on investing in Steam, finally. Not to mention, can't wait to see what this thing can handle, emulation-wise (Can't wait to try Stepmania on this). [Edit/ Update 9/7/21 -Stepmania runs just like arcade Dance Dance Revolution on MAX graphical program settings. Just a little side note, SOME games that have a max refresh rate of 60hz may have graphical issues... I'm specifically mentioning Sonic Adventure & Adcenture 2 for PC being OVERLY FAST. There are workarounds to get said games working perfectly.]Build seems solid. Got the Gray version & am not disappointed at all by my choice. It has a nice blue tinit to it.[Update 9/7/21- Dont expect to get a ton of battery use out of this thing. Setting battery saver settings via windows & dragon center to as max as possible & lowering screen brightness might get 6 to 8 hours of battery life, with just normal, no gaming computer use. Thankfully you can calibrate battery when needed to extend the service life of it.] [Another note: if you run demanding thinga in this, it will get hot to hold. My suggestion, buy a GOOD laptop stand with fan cooling. I would suggedt KLIM Ultimate RGB for if you are a gamer that plays less demaning games. Binding of Isaac, Emulation, etc. Said cooler would probably be good for some demanding games too, with Cooler Boost function turned on to help get some extra airflow]This may be The best "budget" gaming laptop out there atm. Got the 512 GB Model with 16 GB ram & the RTX 3060. Going to eventually go overkill with max ram & a 2 tb Samsung SSD. Can't wait to see what this thing can unleash then... but for now, happy camper!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021

Title: A One Month Review
Review: REASON FOR PURCHASE - I purchased this laptop because my Dell XPS 8100 desktop kept freezing/restarting several times a day.  A fresh clean re-install of Windows 10 was not remedying the situation, and I had no desire to troubleshoot every component to see what was the underlying problem.  Overall, this issue was seriously affecting my productivity, as well as sanity.POTENTIAL ALTERNATIVES - I was mainly looking for a desktop replacement - not a laptop.  I checked Dell, Amazon, BestBuy, as well as other 'PC build' websites such as 'ibuypower', but found prices too high overall.  Basically, the price was the driving factor for me in purchasing this laptop.  The final price was slightly under $1,300 w/ taxes, and I found that to be a fair price for performance ratio.MUST HAVES - Since this was my first PC replacement in nearly 10-years, I wanted to make sure I got a 11th Gen i7 Intel processor, as well as an RTX 3000 series graphics card.  I was looking for a RTX 3060ti minimum, but I could not find a match within my budget.PREVIOUS HARDWARE - My Dell XPS 8100 was still using the 1st Gen i5 650 processor, with a PNY GTX 970 updated graphics card.  I honestly would have gone another year or two before changing my PC, if these freezing problems were not there.FIRST IMPRESSIONS - Seems well built - I also liked the keyboard lighting.  Chassis seems solid, and I liked all the available ports on the sides.  The design was appealing, being perfectly rectangle with the lid closed - no protruding sections to put the shape out of balance.HOW IT IS USED - I use this laptop as a desktop replacement - I only open the screen lid to power it on.  Otherwise, I use an external monitor and keyboard.HOW OFTEN USED - I keep this laptop on for at least 8-hours a day.  It was purchased roughly a month ago, so it's been used rather frequently.GAMING (@ 1080p only) - It is a notable upgrade from my Dell.  Previously in games like WoW or FFXIV, I was getting under 60 FPS frequently in crowded areas.  Now, I get dizzy by how quickly the screen rotates in-game, forcing me to lower the mouse-sensitivity.  In WoW, I am constantly at 100 FPS with the occasional dips to 90 FPS.  I'm also currently playing Ubisoft's 'The Division', but the max I can get is 60 FPS with regular dips to 47 FPS @ medium settings.  Not killer performance, but a huge upgrade nevertheless.FAN NOISE - For everyday non-gaming use (i.e., web browsing), it is a low hum you can only hear if you're within 20-inches to the laptop.  When gaming, it can ramp up to a constant loud whirl.HEAT - Similarly to fan noise, heat is negligible for non-gaming use.  For gaming, it can get warm over time, but I use this product: 'Zimilar Monitor Stand Riser', to keep it propped up for heat dissipation.  It seems to work well in keeping this laptop cool.STORAGE - It only comes with one 512GB M.2 device, so storage for my gaming needs is very limited.  I looked at YouTube videos to see if it can be upgraded, but it honestly looked like a PITA to do so.  So, I have invested in external SSD solutions for space.WIFI – My router is roughly 25-feet away (through walls), but I get consistent download/upload speeds with the occasional dip.  No major connection loss or issues otherwise.BLOATWARE - It comes with a lot of MSi propriety software, as well as Norton Security Suite.  Also, a trial version of Microsoft Office 365.  I spent a good amount of time sorting through, and uninstalling a lot of them.BATTERY - I've only tested it off the plug once.  Even without gaming, it was eating through the battery pretty quickly.  I surmise it'd only go about 3-hours before draining out.  This laptop is definitely not recommended if longevity off the plug is a priority of yours.PROBLEMS – The only ‘issue’ I’ve come across is if I’ve gamed for a long period of time, or I’ve been moving large files around.  The performance of the laptop may drop significantly.  I remedy this by a simple reboot, which clears up the issue.  Also to note, this laptop has not frozen on me once.CONCLUSION - When I purchased this laptop, I considered it an intermediary, until I gathered the necessary funds to invest in a desktop with a minimum of RTX 3070.  However, it has proven to be a mini-powerhouse.  I don't play above 1080p, and I can live with medium-settings if performance seems to dip.  It performs excellently on non-gaming tasks, and I now have a mobile gaming platform if I want to take it to a friend's house.  All-in-all, I am quite satisfied with my purchase, and may now wait until the RTX 4000 series come out before I consider a desktop.Overall, highly recommended for purchase.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021

Title: Don't waist your money!
Review: At first we were excited.. the computer loaded and booted quickly.. Shortly after loading Rust we noticed the Computer overheats quickly with very loud fans that don't seem to help at all. Within 2 days the Mouse pad stopped working.. rust started to lag ... escape from tarkov started to lag also. The computer would not last without being connected to the charger constantly.  For $1300.00..... no working mousepad.... can't shoot or move at the same time with a mouse and we've tried multiple.... computer can't hold a charge.... games lagging.... Over heats easily... this computer is a crying mess.

Review: El equipo está muy bien construido, completamente de aluminio, un diseño muy elegante. A pesar de poseer especificaciones gamer, se puede jugar perfectamente todos los videojuegos actuales, pero bajando un poco las opciones gráficas, pues se calienta por sobre los 80C jugando PUBG en ultra 1080p al igual que con CONTROL. Title: Light as a feather
Review: I've owned 3 laptops and 2 custom built PC's, and I've gotta say that so far this is my favorite computer I've owned to date. I'm downsizing from a 17inch HP Omen gaming laptop (that weighed 10 pounds) but it is in no way a downgrade. I bought this mainly because it's lightweight, portable, has a long battery life, and can put out when it comes to gaming (high to ultra graphics on AAA @ 1080p). In addition to using it for gaming, I also teach high schoolers. Using it in the classroom will be a breeze BECAUSE OF HOW LIGHT AND PORTABLE IT IS. Also it has an HDMI port for hooking up to your projector, and 3 regular usb ports for your powerpoint clicker, mouse and USB all at the same time (also has 2 USB-C connections). No joke, I'm in love with this thing mainly because I've never had a laptop this light and I'm excited to take it everywhere with me without killing my back.

I’m not a huge gamer but the games I do play don’t lag and are very sharp 👌🏻 Just don’t buy used from Amazon. They shipped it without the original packaging and it was put in a box too small with no shipping protection. Needless to say it was damaged on arrival. I returned it and just bought it new and I love this computer.

Title: Fast little computer! 🖥
Review: This is a very nice and fast little laptop. I'll admit I didn't buy this for gaming. I bought this as an upgrade to my 7 year old laptop. I was going to go with an Alienware laptop I saw, but this one was quite a bit cheaper with a newer processor. I dont know much about computers, but this little guy starts up and is ready in seconds. My old laptop took almost 10 minutes to figure out what it was doing. Web pages and docs are pulled up in a second and basic functions are very fast. I like how I can change performance based on what I'm doing bit havent used that feature since it's so fast out of the box. It took a very short time to get set up and registered. I honestly couldn't be happier. I saw some mixed reviews on it and took a chance. I personally am not dissapointed. It may not operate as fast for other with more experience or as a gaming computer, but this works perfectly for my day to day operations. Very happy trying a new product and will probably be back for a second desktop at some point.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021

Title: Great For Studying And For Gaming
Review: As an upcoming college student who enjoys to play games but still needs a laptop to study on, I found that this laptop is exceedingly capable of doing both. Take this review with a grain of salt however as I am not really knowledgeable of the exact specs of the laptop and what the technical terms necessarily means. But what I know for sure is that this laptop is great for a combination of studying and gaming as 15.6' screen is the perfect balance between gaming laptop and a Chromebook, thus, not taking up all your desk space and allowing room for textbooks and journals, while still allowing for a comfortable screen size for gaming. The only true worry I have about the laptop is how hot it can get by just having the laptop in "Balanced Mode", a mixture between power saving and quality frames and resolution, near the vents. But I am sure this can be somehow dealt with either through adjustments, either through changing settings and another way. Overall, the MSI 15m Stealth is a great laptop for a student who wants to dabble in gaming alongside his studies at a great price as well.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022

Title: AFFORDABLE, GREAT FIRST GAMING LAPTOP
Review: I bought this MSI Stealth 15M on September 12,2021. When I received the laptop, everything was amazing. Here are pros and cons.PRO:- Can run games such as COD, VAL, CYBERPUNK- LIGHTWEIGHT- LOTS OF STORAGE 450+ GB- DECENT PRESENTATION.- LONG LASTINGCON:- fan is very VERY LOUD especially on cooler boost mode.- CPU has trouble staying at a low temp, never goes pass 90 F but gets at a warm temperature.- GPU gets at a warm temperature, but never burns out.- Sometimes has a message saying "your PC has run into a problem" (only had it twice but still a concern)Aside from cons, I would recommend this computer for gaming start, a cheap laptop instead of a 10,000 dollar Desktop.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2022

Title: A slim and discreet laptop you can play games on
Review: Delivers on what it says.  Slim and light so it's one of the few 15.6" laptops that I would carry around.  I like the subtle design and I'm not a fan of the looks of many gaming laptops.  Also, had plenty of power to play games (AAA) at 1080p.  As long as you're not expecting desktop power and 4k gaming, this will hit the spot.  It also does so at considerably less energy cost than a desktop.All in all, if looks are important to you, this is a great deal on a capable laptop.  Only thing I would improve (on this and almost every laptop) is a better webcam.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021

Title: Trabaja de una manera genial
Review: Esta laptop para juegos es una de las mejores compras que he hecho nunca, la calidad de la pantalla es excelente, es muy fluida y funciona sin problemas. En cuanto a todas las laptops para juegos, tienden a calentarse, así que asegúrate una almohadilla de refrigeración y actualiza tus controladores. Dragon Center es increíble, MSI realmente ofrece un trabajo de calidad, recomiendo encarecidamente este producto a cualquiera. La duración de la batería se puede ajustar pero desenchufar y, dependiendo de lo que estés haciendo, tendrás una cantidad decente de tiempo de juego o si estás haciendo trabajo, tareas escolares, etc. En general, esta sigue siendo una gran compra, definitivamente necesito comprar mi PC después de esto.VentajasTiempo de inicio muy rápidoCorre cualquier programa sin problemas, perfecta tanto para juegos como para trabajo que requieran una gran potencia , como simuladoresDesventajasEl VR tiene un gran problema, no lo ejecuta correctamente , se  debería con parches mas adelanteLos ventiladores hacen demasiado ruido en ocasiones.

Title: I’m impressed
Review: When I originally decided to get into PC gaming I did a ton of research. I kept being led back to the MSI Stealth gaming laptop. I was quite surprised with the ratings it had received previously. A little skeptical I decided to take the plunge. This laptop has been everything I've needed and more! From it's super responsive processor to it's excellent graphics, this laptop is everything the beginner gamer needs.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022

Title: Portable Powerhouse
Review: The MSI Stealth 15M balances portability and pure power. The laptop is really light for a gaming laptop, being under 4 pounds yet it has a RTX 3060 inside. For being such a thin laptop, the keyboard surprisingly remains at a comfortable temperature while playing AAA games. The laptop also comes with a thunderbolt port which is a nice bonus. If you're gaming while plugged in, make sure to change power mode to best performance and if you want a further boost in performance, you change the User Scenario in the Dragon Center software to Extreme Performance. You can also activate the Cooler Boost if you don't mind more fan noise.The screen runs at 144 Hz but needs a little bit of color calibration out of the box. This is a minor issue that can be fixed through software.Overall, this laptop is a great choice if you value portability but don't want to compromise on hardware specs. Thanks MSI and Amazon!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021

Title: Light and fast processing
Review: Previously I had an old dell laptop from a few years ago with HD disk and the difference in speed with SSD is very good. The design of this laptop is very comfortable and elegant. For the cost I think it is a very good option. The only detail that I have noticed is the webcam, which does not have much video quality. The size of the screen is adequate, it is not very large but it is not small either, so being a thin laptop allows you to travel comfortably. You can also upgrade to Windows 11. If your budget is not big enough to buy a laptop of 2,000 USD or more, this is an excellent option.

MSI's Dragon Center is an awesome feature to monitor your computers performance and for customization.

Title: TRAP : BUYER BEWARE
Review: I bought this seeing the price tag. Seemed like a good deal. Got the product, after about 5 hours of use it would no longer turn on. I take it to the apple store a week later, it turns on when I get there, they run a diagnostics test: battery fails testing, charging ports fail testing. Does not turn on when we attempt to restart.K, time to return it. Whats the return policy? if you do not remove the accounts from the device, they can keep up to 50% of the return. Well how am I supposed to remove the account if the product doesn't reliably turn on. Why on earth is this my problem now?Several hours on the phone with amazon later, several weeks into the process, and after several screw ups from amazon's returns team, I finally got an assurance on my refund for sending the item back.Its not enough really. Thats my time down the drain dealing with all this BS. These guys have a 3.8 rating on Amazon, that is TRASH, and it was my mistake for not heeding that. A 4.4 rating is the AVERAGE rating on amazon, these guys are way below that and rightfully so. If you want a refurbished apple notebook that meets quality standards, you need to cough up the dough and buy through Apple directly. Don't give these guys your money.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020

Title: I received a dirty and bumped Macbook
Review: I received a dirty, bumped computer and I decided to return it right away. The conditions were very different to the publication. Be careful.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020

Title: Got the exact model i asked for and the laptop is working fantastically.
Review: The laptop is in almost brand new condition. It has a few minor scratches here and there but overall fantastic condition. Overall Battery life is great. The processor can handle everything i put it through and i have even BootCamped it for Windows 10.Obviously everyone knows that Macs are not meant for gaming however i do play Tetris Effect when i boot this Mac on windows and the laptop handles the game wonderfully, but keep in mind that the fans will end up blowing at full speed if you play for extended periods of time and yes. It can handle Minecraft.

Title: Had stickers attached and no Power cord or pack!

I am very disappointed that this wasn't made clear....now I have to go out and purchase a cord and power pack, just to find out if this will even work....find it very incredible that this was not included with my purchase.

Title: I had an issue with the machine, but the seller was great.
Review: I purchased this MacBookPro and loved it, but soon after I got it (about two weeks) the screen had issues.  It was within the 90 day return window so they accepted the return immediately.  I received my refund very quickly, and purchased another one from the same seller right away.  The first one was most likely a fluke, because my current MacBookPro runs great with no problems.  I purchased the protection plan, so repairs would have been inconvenient, but not tragic.  Hey, things happen--these are machines.  I am very happy with the seller and how well and quickly they made things right.  I will definitely buy from them again.  Thanks, I love my MacBookPro!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020

Title: Awesome refurbished MacBook Pro - Enjoying it by now.
Review: Despite I was hesitant to buy a refurbished MacBook Pro, adding that some buyers had a non favorable at all reviews when I was thinking to buy, I decided to try with this vendor Kanga and if any issue happens, to return it before the 90 days period.By now being the third day after "unboxing", the experience has been so pleasant, with the following highlights:1.- Speakers performs like sound bar systems, even better that some bars for TVs. I've been listening this morning a Pink Floyd concert in YouTube and i've found its flawless sound is amazing, much better than my 50 inches Smart TV.2.- It had MacOS Monterey preinstalled, and after a not so long update, I had the latest version 12.4, with all current patches.3.- It has a minor scratch on the back of the screen, and I won't see it when I put the case on the MacBook Pro, so I don't care too much of this. It looks and behave like new MacBook Pro, in a mint condition, despite it is at least 5 years old.4.- Coming from a MacBook Pro 2015, I'm getting used to the touch bar, however the learning curve has been no significant and I'm learning quickly its features. Touch Bar working fine at the moment.5.- Touch ID did follow its procedure to acquire my finger marks, so now its working fine too.6.- I believe those who mentioned bad experiences with their buys, however that is not my case until now.7.- I may think by a moment that I'm using a MacBook Pro with M1 Pro, without paying that hefty price. However when looking that the Apple support status it is out of warranty, so I'm coming back to the reality.8.- I found it required additional hardware to connect with my HDs with Thunderbolt for USB C, so having converters I did the first Time Machine backup with no issues.9.- Battery is above 90% capacity, with no cycles of use, so I understand the degradation may come because of the time and not by a previous use.I'm trying to use adding heavy workloads to the MacBook Pro in order to find any possible issue (like graphic card bugs), however at this moment the behavior is very good as expected.So I congratule Kanga to deliver this excellent device that I'm enjoying by now. However if something changes, I will update this review in the coming days, or to return it at the first failure.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019

Title: I was nervous about it coming with many scratches and dinks but...

I found a few minor scratches on the screen that are only visible looking at them up close in light, but other than that, the condition is amazing! Battery only came with 81 cycles(Very low for a refurbished/used laptop). Performance with both light and heavy tasks is flawless! I 100% recommend this laptop for someone who is wanting a great deal on a high performance laptop. Very happy with my purchase! :)

Title: Great computer with some minor issues
Review: First off, everything with this computer internally is correct and exactly what I ordered. Battery is still fairly good with ~120 cycle count. Computer runs like it’s brand new. Computer even came with a brand new apple charger, which I was not expecting. However, in regards to the external part of the computer, there is definitely wear/tear/scratches even though the product description says looks like new. I am ok with the wear and tear as I still got a great deal on this particular model vs. other sites. There is a pretty significant and deep scratch underneath the screen next to the macbook pro logo. There’s is a chunk/dent on the left side of the computer base and there is a scratch on the back. Personally, I am fine with these issues just because I got an awesome deal but just don’t expect your model to come in external grade A condition. Overall, I’m happy with my purchase.

Title: Piece of junk that looks like a good deal
Review: Bought this for my wife who needed something with some CPU and basic GPU power for computing (small video editing, streaming). Worst piece of junk I've ever had the (dis)pleasure of buying. I'll start with the faulty motherboard ports, which don't work on one side due to the laptop most likely having been just thrown into a box and declared "GOOD TO GO" instead of an actual circuit check. Battery power is nonexistent even on easy processes like surfing the web. The wifi adapter is also garbage (-50 MPBS off a 600 dollar windows laptop). The screen is advertised as retina display but not only does it look like junk compared to a 600 dollar windows laptop from dell but the vaunted 'powerbar' feature quit working within a month. Charging is slow even with multiple chargers, does not hold a charge...contacted seller no response.More importantly, this is a mish-mash of AMD and Intel components. DO NOT buy this machine if you want any sort of satisfying experience. DO NOT buy this machine if you want a working laptop for more than a few weeks. DO NOT buy this machine even if it looks like a deal, because between Apple's faulty engineering and the non-existent refurbishment the laptop came with I would have been better off setting fire to my $1500 dollars. Buyer beware on this "deal".Worst laptop I've ever bought.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2020

Title: A powerful and versatile tablet/laptop
Review: Coming from a traditional laptop, this is an amazing option if you want a truly versatile and convenient computer. I wouldn't expect to play games at the highest settings but for it's price point it makes sense.I didn't think I'd be using the touchscreen as much as I thought. It is super smooth like you'd expect a high end tablet.The keyboard is easy to get used to. I'm used to a full size keyboard but I don't really miss it so that's a great sign. It's really easy to switch between tent mode, tablet mode, or laptop mode. 2 USB ports is kind of limiting.The pen works really well. The plastic piece that attaches to the USB port is really cheap feeling and doesn't hold the pen upright (even though there's a hole on top as if it's supposed to) but it's not a big deal. Out of the box it doesn't seem to be as smooth as the lens like from the Samsung tab S7 plus, but I'm sure it just takes some messing with the settings.The battery life is really good. I'd say it's on par with laptops. You could get by almost the whole day without charging and if you need to, it charges pretty quickly.Overall I'm very happy with this laptop and I'm excited to work on creative projects with it!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Title: Nice laptop; Be Aware of Battery Conservation Mode in Lenovo Vantage
Review: I have only had this laptop for about a month.  Overall, I really like it so far and have had no trouble transitioning from Windows 10 to Windows 11, although I don't give this machine a lot of tasks; it's my travel computer and my bedside companion.I did have a concern about the battery charging, though, and I want to alert people to the issue. If you don't want to read this review any further, just please remember to keep the Lenovo Vantage software on your computer in case you need it.First, the laptop ships with a charger that is a small brick with a cable that has a three-prong wall plug and another cable that connects to the USB-C port on  the laptop.  I used the charger and the battery charged up to 100% with no problems.  I had my battery set to "Battery Saver" in the Windows 11 system settings.The laptop does have the older type of round charging port, but you have to buy a separate charger to use it.  So that's what I did; I went to the Lenovo site and bought that charger---which by the way, is not too lightweight itself, but at least it's more manageable for use on trains and such, and it has the two-prong wall plug.So last night, I decided I had better make sure the additional (travel) charger worked okay.  I noticed, though, that my battery was only charging up to 60% of capacity.  The charger was powering the machine, but the battery wasn't filling up.  I thought maybe the charger was defective.  At that point I switched to the charger that came with the laptop, but with that charger, also, the battery wasn't charging beyond 60%!  Oh, no!  At that point, I thought my laptop must be a lemon.  I downloaded an additional software from the Lenovo site, Lenovo Diagnostic Tool, and ran a test on the battery.  The battery test failed!I remembered that another Amazon customer who had reviewed this laptop had complained that he couldn't charge his battery beyond 60%.  A Lenovo representative responded something about a setting that prevented full loading of the battery to extend battery life if the laptop is kept plugged in.  I looked for that setting in the Windows battery settings, and changed my Power Mode setting to Best Performance, but that didn't help.  I could find nowhere in the Windows Settings to get the battery to charge more fully.Eventually, I looked in the Lenovo Vantage software, under More Settings, and found that my machine had been set (not be me, I swear) to Conservation Mode.  This setting is only in the Lenovo Vantage software, and is NOT the same as Battery Saver in the Windows settings.  Once I changed my laptop from Conservation Mode to Rapid Charger in Lenovo Vantage, my battery started charging again.The purpose of Conservation Mode is to conserve the life of the battery if the laptop is continually kept plugged in.  Because that's how I use the laptop, I will continue to use Conservation Mode, but will try to remember to switch to Rapid Charge mode if I want to take the laptop to another location without taking along a charger.I suspected that the travel charger I purchased separately had somehow triggered the computer to convert from Conservation Mode to Rapid Charge, but that is not the case.  If the computer is in Rapid Charge mode, either charger will charge the battery to 100%.  If the battery has a charge of less than 60%, and the computer is in Conservation Mode, either charger will charge it to 60%.  If the battery has a charge of between 60% and 100%, the computer is then put into Conservation Mode and plugged into either charger, the computer will be powered by the charger but the battery will not be further charged.I hope this review is helpful.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022

Title: Value for money if you buy at the deal price
Review: The laptop works as expected. Performance and battery life is at par. I manage to work for 5-6 hours with full brightness and medium work load. I frequently work with 10+ tabs open with lot's of medium computation programming in parallel. The laptop pulls it off without a hick. Built quality is decent, the top panel could have used an extra screw around touchpad. Make sure you update the BIOS and Drivers. I faced some graphic hiccups before that. Consider Yoga series if you want a metal body and better screen.Pros:- Value for money if you manage to get it around 600 for Ryzen 5 & 16Gb. I did!- Comes with the Pen (Double check the listing)- Speakers are loud for a call, but not great for music- Fingerprint reader is very responsiveCons:- Fingerprint does not wake up the computer from sleep- No auto-brightness.- RAM is not upgradable- No space for 2.5" HDD but you can swap the SSD- Average Brightness- Average Webcam- The cooling fan tends to get loud as there isn't sufficient clearance between laptop and table.That being said, none of this is a dealbreaker, and I would still recommend the product.

Title: 6.5/10 - Good for Daily web browsing and  some office work

Title: A Very Good Basic Laptop
Review: I've been stumbling along for a while with a six-year-old Lenovo laptop. Time to update. I've had good luck with Lenovo, so I searched and found this model.  ‎Ideapad Flex 5 14 Laptop.It's been 100% satisfactory for basic computing tasks. Email, web browsing, shopping and doing all the daily digital tasks you have.  It comes with a 512 GB SSDI. Get it with 16 GB of RAM. (The difference between 8 GB and 16 GB of RAM is breathtaking.) It is fast and responsive.Like most PCs, it doesn't have enough USB ports. Fortunately, you can get high-quality, multi-outlet USB hubs for almost nothing. It also doesn't have an ethernet port. I had no idea those were being phased out. Doesn't really matter; the Wi-Fi is quick and easy.Comes with Windows 11. Not as daunting as I thought. You'll figure it out.This can be your go-to digital device. Let it.Jim Tedford

Title: Great Device!  Only one Complaint...

Title: Extreme bang for your buck
Review: This is my 3rd Lenovo laptop and it does not disappoint! I’ve had it for about 2 months now and I am honestly very happy with my purchase. I am an engineer and a bit picky with my tech and considering the price, I don’t think you can find a better performing laptop for the price.The Ryzen 5 5500U processor is blazing fast and the 16GB RAM is sufficient to handle multiple programs simultaneously without a problem. My model only has a 256GB SSD (this model was on a special for $599), but if you are using the cloud it is more than sufficient storage. I even run an Ubuntu dual boot with 60 GB allocated and the remaining storage on the Windows side is still plenty.The touch screen and the stylus pen are significantly better than I expected. I’ve never had a touch screen laptop but I’m impressed with the responsiveness and the quality of the touch and draw features. I don’t use them very often though since I’m mostly writing software.I do a lot of typing and I really like the keyboard (though I am not one of the picky software types with mechanical keyboards complaining about key travel distance and such).I was aware of the low brightness screen (you won’t be able to work outside), the lack of display-over-USB-C capability (I just use the HDMI port) and the USB-C charger which eliminates the use of the USB-C port for other peripherals (I just use a small USB-C dock with extra ports), but I decided that for the price of the laptop, these are worth living with.One thing that bothers me a little bit though is location of the power button. It is on the side of the laptop (on the right side), and I’ve pressed it accidentally a few times while adjusting the position of my laptop, which puts the laptop to sleep. Thanks to the SSD I can get it running again within a few seconds, but it is slightly annoying.Overall I can highly recommend this laptop for someone that wants great performance at a low cost (but willing to live without certain nice-to-haves).
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2022

Title: Great 2-In-1 for the Price But Defective Pen
Review: I picked this up because I've been wanting a 2-in-1 to do some of my digital artwork on but also use as a laptop when I'm not using it for art.The processor is fantastic and can handle anything I throw at it, including some light gaming. I'm a fan of the design and, while it's a little heavier than typical ultrabooks, it's not a huge weight as I take it with me through my day.The two big drawbacks are the screen and the pen that came with it.The screen doesn't have a huge color gamut so the colors aren't super accurate but, because I finish off the color work on my art on my desktop later on in my process, that's not a major problem for me. The bigger issue with the screen is the LOW max brightness. It tops out at 250 nits which means it's close to impossible to see outdoors on anything except for a completely overcast day but even just using it indoors basically requires you to keep it at max brightness to see clearly.The digital pen that came with it was defective. I could use its passive features like basic drawing and interacting with the screen (just like you can with your finger because it's a touchscreen) but the pen wouldn't pair at all with the laptop or any of my other devices. I went through all the troubleshooting steps in the manual online and through every other troubleshooting info I could find after spending hours on Google searching for help. I made sure it wasn't a dead battery and that the laptop paired just fine with other bluetooth devices so, unfortunately, the pen was dead on arrival and the pen being included with the laptop was part of the value proposition of the device so where I would have given it four stars had the pen worked, I had to drop it down to three since that's $50 worth of defective product there.The laptop itself would work well for anyone who would never have to use it outdoors or in direct sunlight indoors as long as you keep the brightness at maximum all the time.Because of the low brightness and the defective pen, I have to give it three stars overall instead of the four it would have earned otherwise.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Title: Great Laptop for the price

Material feels premium, keyboard, touchpad, speakers are good (not great). Comes with Windows 11. Microsoft office is pre-installed but not activated so you have to pay for it. I didn't see it in the pictures but the screen fully rotates and you can use it as a pad.The things I didn't like:Webcam - its 2022 and 80$ phones have decent cameras, It's a pity laptop producers don't put better web cameras in their PC's.Second is the screen. Resolution is good, but the brightness is a bit low. Also colors feel a bit inaccurate a bit yellowish and washed out.

Title: So pleased, does all I needed and more!
Review: I am so glad that I went ahead an bought this. I needed a small portable computer that I could take to a number of places to work on ongoing projects. I wanted something that would be smaller, lightweight, have an attached keyboard, functioning USB ports and enough memory to be able to use multiple internet pages at the same time while utilizing OneDrive to create documents. I bought this hoping for the best, I mean given the price tag I was almost certain that I would be handing it off to my sister for my little nephew to play games on, but nope! Mine all mine!!! I waited to review until I had used in all of the capacities that I required and it has done all that I needed and then some! Super lightweight and handy, I can have it on my leg while balancing papers to review on the other while waiting for appointments. It quickly accesses the internet and has worked wonderfully in tandem with OneDrive and other internet functions. I could not be happier. BTW because of the extra USB ports (3) I was able to attach a remote mouse and it works seamlessly also. Did I say that I am Happy?!?!11/9/19 Wanted to add an update. Over a year later and this notebook still works fabulously! I find myself using it far more than my laptop these days because it is so versatile and lightweight. I have not once had an issue with it in any way. Not only woukd I buy it again I would recommend it to anyone looking for something similar!

Title: Pinch me
Review: Let's skip the part where we acknowledge the fact that Chromebooks, in general, are incredibly awesome...fast, reliable, can do basically everything you need to do unless you're a recording engineer or you work for Dreamworks...or if you insist on using one of the few remaining proprietary software programs that hasn't migrated online yet (hint: it's 2019...stop fighting it). Anyway, let's skip that part because you already know this and that's why you're looking at Chromebooks.We are now a 6-Chromebook family. Everyone has one now. 4 of them are Samsungs. I just purchased my 2nd of these little Samsung dudes, both from this seller, factory refurbs. Here's why you should pull the trigger on this right now:1. It may be "refurb", but they look brand new. And because of Chromebooks "powerwash" feature, they are fully wiped just like a brand new from-the-factory job.2. There's no such thing as a 100% never-fail piece of electronic equipment. So you want to get yours from a place that will have your back if it's not right. The first one we ordered had a problem with the keyboard. Keys would stick. I called the number on the box, got a native English-speaking dude from Connecticut, and he happily overnighted another one to me immediately, along with a prepaid return tag for the faulty one. The replacement worked perfectly and has been working for many months so far.3. As a laptop, this one is pretty great. It's fast, the screen is bright and clear, it's super light, the battery lasts forever, the build quality is high...and it just FEELS like a nice laptop.4. DID YOU SEE THE PRICE??There are down sides to everything. It's not as cool as MY Samsung Chromebook (the touch-screen Pro). But I could buy 3-4 of these for the cost of one of mine. I'm sure that if you want to burst this little laptop's bubble, you can open a million windows and see if it can edit video and print and browse cat videos at the same time. But don't be that guy. You wanna get silly with your laptop, buy a Chromebook Pro like mine. I'm still waiting for that one to bog down after 2.5 years of daily use and lots (and lots and lots) of international travel. For normal people who use web apps and email and edit video on WeVideo and knock out accounting on QBO and...for the love of all things holy, consider getting over the hump and using Google Office (and thank me in 6 months) this laptop is all you probably need. If it'll make you feel better, buy two of them and pretend it costs twice as much. Then you'll have a backup in case you forget and go swimming with the first one.In all seriousness, welcome to the world of Chrome OS. I love it here, and I think you will too.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2018

Title: Light, fast and very basic.
Review: The applications are limited and almost every software is based on google chrome. While you have the ability to install apps from Google Play, several of these are directed to cell phones and do not adapt 100% to the the Chromebook OS.The access to extra GB by MicroSD & USB is restricted, which limits its use and the possibility of increasing the poor 16Gb RAM the Chromebook has inside.It has a good performance and easy mobility.Microsoft Office is too basic, I hope a more complete version is offered soon.Regarding the otrher advantages, it is a fast and surprisingly light device.

Title: Good Netbook
Review: I bought this primarily for work but I actually use it more than my regular laptop!Pros:- The battery life is really good! If I use it strictly for work, I only have to charge it every 3 days or so. It can handle a Netflix binge easily and charges fairly quickly.- It is very lightweight so it is easy to carry around. This was an important factor to consider when shopping for a netbook for work.- It is made by Samsung and lives up to the reputation of good, quality productsCons:- Keypad: I find that I have to push dramatically on the keys, otherwise some letters may be missing from the text. I guess if it got really annoying you could use a Bluetooth keyboard but it doesn’t bother me enough to do so.- Screen: the screen is matte so sometimes this is annoying when watching things in the daytime.Overall, I recommend it - especially if you’re just looking for a small laptop to browse the web and stream movies. It’s a good “coffee shop laptop” too.

Title: Thrilled with the quality and features at the price point ...

Battery stays up under heavy use for hours on end. Streams video seamlessly.  May not be top of the line, but certainly not the bottom of the barrel.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018

Title: Amazing Machine!  Amazing Concept!
Review: This is a fantastic machine married with fantastic concept; i.e., online operating system!  Here are the many virtues:  1.  Inexpensive; if someone steals it, you lost a few hundred dollars, not a few thousand!  2.  Works fast and efficiently for the most needed activities, such as checking email and web surfing.  3.  Operating system is online; this helps with speed immeasurably!  4.  Online environment has taken care of security and keeps it up to date.  5.  Long battery life and short recharge time.  5.  Strong bluetooth connection.  6.  Intuitive "menu".  7.  Aligned with Google, and let's face it:  Google is everywhere!!!I have been extremely happy with this "system"!  I don't know if I'll ever go back, to be honest!  Instead, I'll probably just upgrade to a better version one day, if and when I start to notice any limitations.Since purchase, I've learned some things:  1.  Chrome stops "supporting" these computers after a few years; I don't know what that means; a computer geek would know.  2.  Chrome doesn't like "cookies."  This is probably a good thing from a security perspective, but there are some systems out there that don't "play nice" if you don't accept their cookies; Chrome isn't going to play with those systems.  3.  Doesn't support "Internet explorer"; I don't know the politics behind it, and generally, it's not a problem, but, for example, the gym I belong to, in response to COVID, decided to use internet explorer to design its scheduling system; Chrome doesn't support it.  If I didn't have a work computer with Explorer, I wouldn't be able to schedule my classes, and I'd be in a real funk!All in all, these limitations don't affect me too much.  I'm not a computer sophisticate; if I were, maybe they'd  bother me more!  In sum, if you want a fast, efficient computer, where you can connect to all things Google-related, and not have to worry about viruses or updates (because it all happens online), and you're not a computer geek or videographer, and you want to do basic things like email, YouTube, and basic documents (for notes and spreadsheets), then this is an excellent solution!In closing, I can't wait to take this on travel with me in the Fall; no longer will have to be worried about my $2,000 MacBook Air being stolen or lost in transit!  This little machine's compatibility with the most popular systems out there means I can pretty much do everything I need, without incident!  I'm tired of systems (MacBook) that don't play well with others!  I want user friendly systems, and systems that are kept current and up to date at all times!  This machine; i.e., portal, gets me there!  Such a brilliant idea and concept!  Very appreciative for this innovative invention!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2018

Title: My bad. This is a great little lap top
Review: I mistakenly gave this 2 stars because I thought the power cord wasn't included. It is. My bad. This is a great little lap top. Great screen, very fast
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2018

Title: Great, Simple Laptop; Top Notch Seller!
Review: Next month, I will have had this Chromebook for 2 years; it's the very device I'm typing this on right now. I bought this to replace my very old Toshiba netbook that was running Windows 7 Starter. I used that poor Netbook until it just couldn't go on. It has been laid to rest in my electronic drawer. But I digress; I'm a writer, at the time of purchase I had just been hired as a copywriter by a marketing firm and I needed a reasonable fast computer for research and word processing. No bells and whistles were on my checklist, I just wanted something that could handle a lot of open tabs, word processing, and the occasional YouTube video. I couldn't be happier with this Chromebook! What's more is that even though it was refurbished, it came well packaged, and pristine. It looked like I had made a trip to Best Buy. I haven't had one single performance issue in the two years I've been using it, and as someone doing a LOT of research, I'm not exactly easy on the device in that regards. So, if you're looking for a computer for class, writing, browsing, or researching, then this is a great choice, and the refurbished product I chose was (and still is) fantastic. Oh, and it doesn't heat up like the traditional older laptops. My thighs really appreciate that perk.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020

Title: easy to use
Review: Black in color. Just the right size to carry around in backpack. Will do anything that you need to get done. I does not have Microsoft. Portable, easy to use. Has long battery life. I would recommend this for someone on the go. Cons you are limited on what and how much you can download. This is great for a teen or to do simpler stuff. Does not come with Word. For a first computer this is great. My 11 year old loves it and is very happy with it. If you are someone who just goes on internet to play games and pay bills this is for you. I do not mind using it myself and I have more high text devices. It gets the work done.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2018

Title: Good little laptop for studenta
Review: I really thoroughly enjoy this little chrome book! I wanted a lighter computer to carry around university with me, and this works perfectly for that. It was really easy to get used to, though I’m an avid chrome suites user anyway, a Mac user or Microsoft fan might have a longer period to get used to it. The battery life often lasts me three school days without having to recharge (10-12ish hours of continuous use?) Everything boots up quick and easily, and I personally really enjoy the bluetooth capability!I haven’t had any issues with the refurbished-ness of it either. It works perfectly and like brand-new! Came with the laptop, and charging cable.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020

Title: Can't beat this quality + price!
Review: This is such a steal for the price. I've had this laptop for a few weeks now and I really like it. The battery lasts for such a long time. I usually use it for 2 or 3 hours a day and I can go about 4 or 5 days without charging it. I love how it shows the exact amount amount of time there is left until it will die. It starts up very quickly. It's ready to go within 30 seconds of opening it. The only thing I find funny is that I will X out of the website/websites I was on, shut it down, and when I start it back up, the websites will still be there. But it's a very small issue compared to the otherwise great quality you get.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2018

Title: Purchased 2 - Great Value, Brand New?
Review: Due to the Covid-19, my children started online schooling. I bought 2 of these Chromebooks with low expectations. Actually, these Chromebooks appear brand new. I cannot see a single scratch on either Chromebook. In both cases, the battery functioned almost 12-hours, suggesting they are indeed brand new. I know that might not be everyone's experience and maybe I got lucky in my order. As far as a Chromebook, it is functioning flawlessly for my children's needs.Con: I am not a huge fan of Chromebooks. As a parent, Family Link is fantastic. However, if you are using this with a public school account, it will not work. You must use the school's assigned account and so you cannot use a personal minor family link account to oversee. I did not want to spend a lot of money on these computers, so I do not regret my purchase.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2018

Title: Great little Chromebook, excellent price
Review: Samsung is definitely not the top brand for Chromebooks. For the best bang for your buck, you want an Acer. But for such a low price, I don't think you'll find a better product than the Samsung Chromebook 3. I bought it for my mom to replace her desktop PC. So far, it's working very well. Because she's using it as a desktop replacement, I didn't review battery life or the keyboard or touchpad or screen. I used them a bit and they all seem completely good, but I set her up with a 29" widescreen monitor and a USB keyboard and mouse. On that last subject, you'll definitely want to purchase a 4 or 6 port USB hub, as there are only 3 USB ports on the whole thing. This is standard for Chromebooks, though. I did appreciate the inclusion of a Micro SD slot. That's another thing you'll want to get right away. I put a 128GB Micro SD card in there for my mom, as well.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2018

Title: Great value and utility for simple uses
Review: I am surprised by how much I like this chromebook. My main laptop is more powerful but has very poor battery life, so I decided to get the chromebook to work on writing and online tasks when I'm on the go- you could work out of a cafe using battery power for several hours. I've seen reports that this chromebook could last 10-11 hours on battery though my experience has been closer to 6-8 hours, which could be because I got a refurbished model. Though battery isn't perfect it's been suitable so far and I'm impressed with the Chrome OS- it's quite fast and well thought out. There are limitations on the types of apps and software that are available for Chrome but for most tasks there is a Chrome OS solution. I like using the HDMI output to connect to a large monitor and have considered pairing a wireless keyboard and mouse to make it more like a traditional desktop computer for when I'm in an office environment. Once you pair with a larger monitor it becomes a fast/ simple alternative to the traditional desktop computer, and it runs much quieter than my other computer. Overall it's been a great addition that adds versatility and flexibility to my workflow though I might recommend a higher end model or different solution if you're looking for one computer to do everything.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2020

Title: I love it. Had trouble at first using it because ...
Review: I love it. Had trouble at first using it because it wasn't fully wiped. Had to do a factory reset.

Title: Great.

Was able to install the Google Play store easily. A bargain for the price.Update: So impressed with this I purchased a second unit for a family member. Refurbished items can be such a hit and miss and this item is certainly a hit. Second one was as flawless as the first.

Title: Silly good in terms of bang for the buck

As a chromebook it handles itself very well and for most people that's good enough, but I wanted to add a review incase anyone is thinking of this machine for other OS options.  It took about 2 hours to get Gallium 2.1 up and running and it's works flawlessly.  Very happy with it as a light Linux install, and using nomachine I use it as a dumb terminal back to my main desktop for development.  It all just works really well (Nomachine works under chrome OS, but there seems to be no way for ALT-TAB to be associated with the remote machine rather than the local Chrome OS interface)

I want a caps locks button!Very good product for the money.

Furthermore, it's relatively cheap enough that I wouldn't be too unhappy if it got damaged while in transit.So far, it's survived many journeys and it's still functioning like it did on day one.

The laptop itself and the keyboard are fairly small, but that works out just fine for me because I have smaller hands (hand size to laptop size for comparison). Overall you will get exactly what you ask for—I just wanted a simple easy laptop where I can work on my thesis without any extra bells and whistles, and that’s what I got.

Title: If poor saturation matters, consider Grayscale
Review: You will get what you pay for, but not in my case as long as performance & battery life concerned. If it comes with an IPS or OLED instead of a low-end TN screen, it wouldn't be an affordable one.A TN LCD panel has a narrow viewing angle, however, it features a much faster response time than the IPS counterpart, so a gamer's choice nowadays. FYI, WebGL Aquarium test scores amazing 60 fps with 500 fishes running on this Chromebook.The poor saturation is not so terrible but barely acceptable. If that matters, a less distracting grayscale over an addictive color display would be desirable. Unfortunately, a google system-wide grayscale option is not available yet, but as a workaround, a chrome web browser addon like "Grayscale the Web" does a great job.I appreciate they have tried to meet the least common multiple requirements with minimalism in mind.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2022

I bought it for a podcast I plan on starting soon & it’s been awesome so far. This computer can handle anything you can possibly throw at it. I have my recording software downloaded straight from google play & I’ve been doing all my research on it as well as watching Disney+ on it. Title: Great for what I paid
Review: I needed a knockaround laptop to take when I travel.  I used to take my tablet, but more and more I need a full keyboard and a close to full laptop experience.  I don't want to take my work laptop, as I can't risk it.  I've now done a couple of trips with this Chromebook - and it fills the bill.  Is the screen brilliant sharp?  No.  Is it lightning fast? No.  Does it do the job I bought it for?  Absolutely!  And for not too many sheckels.  I rate this a great buy and am glad I picked it up.  Wifi works well.  Battery life is great.  Recharges quick.  I've used it for web surfing, meetings, on-line documents, you-tube watching and movie watching when the hotel options sucked.  If I have any complaint it would be I wish the speakers could put out a bit more volume.

Title: EXCELENTE PARA ESTUDIANTES Y NIÑOS
Review: Excelente para estudiantes, conectividad a internet wifi súper rápido, permite instalar office, zoom y full aplicaciones del play store. Tambien instale para mi hija netflix e iptv y corrieron super bien. Algo que me encantó fue el sonido realmente espectacular. Otra funcion super practica es la transmitir al chromecast la pantalla y sonido inalámbricamente. Super liviana y bonita (parece Mac 😅). Title: Survived a house fire
Review: We experienced a catastrophic house fire 4/23/22. It was sitting in the kitchen under at least 6 inches of wet insulation. It was exposed to extreme temperatures. The microwave door was melted somewhat to give you an example. This powered right up and continues to charge and work everyday since then. I cannot say the same for our 3 gaming PCs or the little's tablets. Our tvs screens even melted. I will forever buy samsung products!!

Title: Value for Money

The commenters with complaints about the screen aren’t wrong, but did you spend $1K? $500? Even $200? No. You spent $170, and you received one of the absolute least expensive laptops out there. If you want a beautiful display, look elsewhere. This laptop does a great job for those who need more functionality than a tablet can provide, at the lowest possible price-point.

Title: I really like it.
Review: Having always used "Windows", and therefore completely new to Chromebook, it is a definate learning curve.  I feel hampered as I've only ever used Microsoft type computers and being elderly may have slowed my learning speed.I will try to update this review as time goes by.My old laptop was extremely slow and I was looking for something different and speedy.First impressions after having a Chromebook for 1 week:-It is FAST.  Pages load really fast!-It was easy to transfer all my data & settings from my old computer, thanks to using Chrome in past years.All my photos are there.  The Chromebook shows you how and guides the process.-The keyboard lighting CAN be brightened to improve key visibility.  This was one of my big concerns as many reviews mention it.  The key were hard to see due to the low lighting at first.  I didn't find a reference to it on the Chromebook at first and needed a quick fix.  A search on Google showed me how.  I followed the instructions and now I can see the keys very well in normal household lighting.-It is a learning curve to learn the keyboard shortcuts.  I am jotting down notes in a notebook.-There is a Chromebook simulator for learning.-It has a easy, sensitive touchscreen.-Screen brightness is easy to adjust.-No detectable heat output.-Battery lasts a long time.-Tablet mode:  Open it completely until the two outside surfaces touch and it is completely flat.  The touchscreen is quite responsive.- Any questions I have regarding how to use this Chromebook can be easily answered by a quick Google search.- The screen comes on instantly when opening, if I don't turn the Chromebook off.  Navigation icons are at the bottom of the screen.Still learning; will update.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021

Title: Excellent experience at a great price
Review: At first, when I read and saw a lot of reviews about this device, I thought that I would buy a device that would meet the purpose, and I did not expect any further increase in any details of the device. On the contrary, I was a little disappointed before the device delivered .But the shock was when I received the device and did the unboxing ... At first, I was amazed by the shape of the slim device and its suitable quality for its price, but you may not get the same design quality in Windows laptops at the same price ... The screen is very good, the brightness and colors are excellent, and the touch is responsive ... The performance of the device and its speed is very good, and it takes seconds to enter the personal account from the shutdown state ... The battery lasts 8 hours with the operation of many applications and maximum brightness .... The sound of the headphones is good, not bad... I did not experience any heat in the device except for a very small amount of heat that was not noticed until I carefully checked it... In short, the device is more than wonderful and an excellent choice for a very good price.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Title: Unexpectedly awesome except for 2 details
Review: After reading many reviews I did not expect anything other than a Chromebook. However many of the things that others seem to be critical of are not an issue  here.....  magnets stick when you close and open into tablet mode. The touch screen works great. The pad works great and the screen is bright. I have reservations because of the many negative reviews. So far so good. I will update you if anything comes up.Update: 7/27/211Backlit keyboard works great too!  I think that most people would agree that once you know how to use a chromebook there are few complications.  However, I still hate the way the cameras work.  Why are they sooooo bad?  It seems like this model would at  least off a better camera.. ....So I am disappointed about the camera and that I cannot use the blur background in meetings.  These seem like small concessions that  chromebooks should add.  I may actually need to swith  to a windows computer because of this issue. Who wants to see my unmade bed during a zoom or  teams meeting?  Noone., and nooine should have to worry about such details.  le
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021

Title: Almost Perfect
Review: This is my first Chromebook, and I love almost everything about it.1. The speed is lightening fast2. It is extremely easy to use. I set it up & played around with it for a couple of hours, and learned a ton about the ins & outs of the Chromebook.3. A big 'Yay', on the lack of useless bloatware that is so common on Windows systems.4. The touch screen and mouse pad are both very responsive.5. The screen is crystal clear, and I absolutely LOVE the night time blue light filter. It is so much more pronounced than similar filters on any of my other devices. It really helps with eye strain, and you can use it during the day if you want as well.If I think of any more positives as I use it more, I will add updates.And now, for the one glaring flaw that kept me from giving five stars; The keyboard could be much better, visually. The keys are light, and so are the letters. There is not much contrast at all, so the letters/numbers are really hard to see. Luckily, I've been typing for so long that I can get by. But it'd be much easier if I could see the letters without straining!Since I love everything else about it though, I will happily keep it. I am good about updating my reviews, so if I run into any more pros or cons I will be sure to edit this.EDIT: I ended up buying a keyboard skin cover that fits and works perfectly. The item description of the one I got here in Amazon is: Keyboard Cover for ASUS Chromebook Flip C434 2 in 1 Laptop, ASUS C302CA/C423NA/C425TA/C433TA/C434TA-DH342T DSM4T DS384T C523NA Chromebook, ASUS Chromebook Protective Skin, Black
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021

Title: Great Chromebook with good price
Review: This is my second chromebook. Compare with Samsung 11.6” Chromebook, monitor is better, response faster and more storage spaceOverall , good1. OK screen, bright is enough if not under sunlight2. 8100Y CPU is enough power for multitask and smooth3. Build quality looks good and durable4. Speaker not bad and loud enoughBad1. hard to open monitor when put on the desk2. Only one Type A USB portsThe end of Google AUP to this laptop is June, 2026Recommend chromebook

Title: Great computer for the price
Review: If you want a laptop with a nice-sized screen, 360 rotation, and touchscreen it's a great laptop at a great price. I've had mine for 3 months now with no issues. I use it for college and a charge lasts me all day until I get back to my dorm. If I don't use it much over the weekend say an hour a day then a full charge will last all weekend. The only downside is that the touch screen is capacitive and not active. If you want to write a lot of notes on your laptop and you can spare another hundred or so get the C436 it has an active screen. My notes are really sloppy and it's not the easiest but it works fine and I only use it in lectures to make annotations on pdfs and then take notes on paper when I get back to my dorm. I wouldn't use it for notes all the time because of that. But for the price it's the best all around for what it offers.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021

Title: Unbeatable Performance at an Unbeatable Price
Review: The ASUS Chromebook Flip C433 2-in-1 Laptop is aesthetically pleasing with the performance to match. It sports 8GBs of lightning-fast RAM with a processor that is equal to the task. The keyboard is beautiful and responsive, and with its vibrant back-lighting, it is clearly visible in any light environment. The 2-in-1 functionality really sets this device apart from its competitors. The captivating display provides unparalleled visual clarity and the touch screen is exceptionally receptive. Although all of these accolades are well deserved, it is the value you receive for your well-earned dollar that genuinely places the ASUS Chromebook Flip C433 2-in-1 Laptop, head and shoulders above all other devices in its class. In summary, this is a responsive, beautiful, and adaptive device that can hold its own against much more expensive laptops at a fraction of the cost.

Title: ease of using a chromebook
Review: Love how lightweight this chromebook is.  It was easy to transfer all of our pictures, documents, email accounts, etc.  Battery life is amazing, we never have to plug it in.  The only thing I do not like is that the keys are a shiny silver and the letters on the keys are very hard to see and they are very close together so I make a lot of typing errors unless I have the keyboard angled a certain way.  I also do not like the touch mouse pad, I'm old school and really like having a mouse.  That being said, after complaining for several days, my husband informed me that it is a touch screen so now I scroll that way and it's easier.  Good product for the money if you aren't keeping payroll, bookkeeping or major work projects.  Haven't tried doing any spreadsheets or graphs yet, this is mostly for entertainment, checking email and uploading pictures!

Title: Good screen, disappointing keyboard and mouse
Review: I love ASUS products, so I was really excited to receive this. Unfortunately, I've found this chromebook quite buggy and awkward. In no particular order:PROS:1. looks nice; sleek. screen is nice and spacious, pretty.CONS:1. Kind of difficult to open up the notebook.2. The keyboard doesn't feel that good to use, and I can't easily find the setting to disable to touchpad while typing. ): Maybe the keyboard is uncomfortable because I have small hands? But that was my experience.3. The touchpad does not feel good to use aaaat aaaaaaall, haha. That's not that big of a deal since I usually use a bluetooth mouse anyways, but there again, since it only has 1 USB port, you can't plug in a keyboard and mouse at once.Unrelated, but I was kind of bummed that this chromebook doesn't qualify for any electronics trade-in programs, so I'm not really even sure how to get rid of it. I'll have to make that a criteria for buying laptops going forward, haha.

Title: Great chromebook but silver keys and white lettering are a horrible combination
Review: I had the previous version of this Chromebook that had a black back lit keyboard.  I loved it but the USB-C ports died and I bought this newer version.  Pretty much works the same but the silver keys with white letter are a horrible idea.  No contrast at all.  Pretty much impossible to see what the key lettering is unless it is a completely dark room.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021

Title: It's okay but I think ACER models have this beat
Review: This looks like a decent unit, but my first gripe is that keyboard is underwhelming, *not* backlit in any meaningful sense (manual says that it is), and the ACER Chromebook, or the Samsung Chromebook have much more tactile and responsive keys.  They also use black keys with white lettering.  Inexplicably the 433 uses silver keys with clear/impossible to read letters.  The keys are also spaced too close.  Go to a real store and try out an ACER keyboard to see what I mean.Next problem, though this applies to any Chromebook:  Not all of the "Android" apps will work on a Chromebook.  Luckily, there is a handy "How to" Geek's article for how to install Signal using the Linux tools that come with a Chromebook.  But I wanted to use my Chromebook just for financial websites, for security. Can't use a Yubico 5NFC 2FA authenticator with a Chromebook.  Not compatible even though there is a USB-A port you can plug the 5 NFC into.Third problem:  On a quick first glance, the outer case looks nice.  But then I noticed small scratches and nicks and this was just opened!  Either I got used model or this material does not wear well.Overall, I find this Chromebook cramped, it feels cheap, and it's a let down because my old Windows 8 ASUS Tablet with  keyboard was such a pleasant surprise.  This was twice the cost and feels worse in every way.  I so wished that I had purchased a larger ACER with  a nicer keyboard.  Really try to check these out in person at a store before buying.  That's my advice.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021

Title: Very much disappointed with dim screen and keyboard
Review: Since, I rated low for this ASUS Chromebook C433TA-AS384T, I wanted to go over cons first.The screen brightness, character sharpness, contrast of this Chromebook is really pathetic. I undertand the term, brightness is comparative, but I can say that with any % of brightness, the characters, screen of any webpage appear as if you are reading on a faded, yellowish news paper and not on a new white page. The other way to explain is, this screen resembles 4000K bulb (yellow tone) and not towards 6000K (day light) color temperature. So, in spite of whichever the brightness setting, the characters looks dull without good color, B&W contrast. This is extremely disappointing for $435 Chromebook. In fact the main point for my purchase was, this has FHD 1920x1080 display and expected the screen to be better than my 5 year old Dell 14 inch Inspiron 1366x768 laptop. But, it turned out that the screen readability is much worse.The keyboard really sucks with same grey color like the laptop color and the characters are hardly readable if you have some lighting in the room. This is very much annoying, but is tolerable with keyboard lighting turned off through Alt + Brightness control key. This seems to be a not good design of keyboard.There is a magnet between the lid and base unit which makes it hard to open the screen, but this inconvenience is also tolerable compared to dim screen issue.The pros are certainly it is very fast and has 8GB RAM.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021

Title: No case that allows the "flip".
Review: Love the chromebook. The battery drained a little faster than I had hoped, but it is fast and the flip feature that turns it into a notebook is awesome. There is a c-type input on both the left and right sides for the power cord which is cool.  There are even these great hard cover cases (like a cell phone case) that come in two pieces so they can stay on even when you flip it to use the notebook feature.  Unfortunately, you need to buy one for that exact model. I found out too late... so if you have a C433 model it won't fit a C432 model case.The seller doesn't make a case for this model that I can find anywhere.  If anyone knows where I can find one please post the info. I was tempted to buy another chromebook in a different model so I could get a hard cover instead of a padded pouch but missed the return window.  The chromebook itself is still pretty cool though!  Just don't drop it if you are using it while walking or moving around.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2021

Title: Good Laptop
Review: It's not a bad comp.First the good: I love that it is 2 in 1. I really love the touch screen too. Seems to be fast so farThe cons: They sent me a refurbished one instead of new. I ordered the new. Amazon offered me money back, which was a good deal so I took it. The Ram needs to be at least a 16 as I see it has over half used and there isn't much running that I know of. It also needs way more storage. I got it and it already has almost half used. Good thing I can use and SSD card but not sure how much.I am going to keep it because I couldn't have got a better deal for it.

Title: Nice qualify

Title: ok chromebook, weird case design
Review: This Chromebook is fast, the battery is fine so far, but it seems the quality is not very good. Backlit keyboard is too dim to clearly see on a rainy day, but is ok in the total darkness. The touch screen is missing touches sometimes. The case itself has rough edges in places. It has a weird placement of a power button and side button for volume control. It always gets into the way when you are picking the laptop, also the volume button is broken and gets stuck in the "volume down" position. And I have not even used this button. Overall I like the laptop enough to keep it, if the volume button would give me more problems I would open the case and "fix" it.

Title: Was the wrong product for me but actually really nice
Review: So I bought this by mistake thinking it was a windows OS and ultimately needed to return it BUT if you are looking for a Google OS PC this is a great product.  Super easy to use, great foldable chassis, super quick. The only thing I didn't like is the key board. Honestly I don't know why they even bothered. It's clearly an after thought being a touch screen. Couldn't read the dsmn thing without dropping my head and begging the light to reflect off the surface in such a way I could read it. Title: Speakers Very Weak
Review: I have to use headphones to watch my college lectures because the speakers are too quiet. Sometimes it locks up on a black screen - I use the power button + refresh to restart it. I use a wireless mouse, not the built in pad, so I can’t speak to its quality. Sometimes the keyboard light isn’t bright enough but it’s fine.
